sections.content: Cross Country Ski Trail Conditions as of February 2, 2026 –

Bucks Run is groomed for skate and classic skiing. The connector trail between the ski center and Bucks Run is open. For your safety and the safety of our staff please adhere to Bucks Run hours.  Bucks Run is open Monday – Friday 12 pm – 7:45 pm and Saturday – Sunday 9 am – 7:45 pm, weather and conditions permitting.
– Trails are groomed. Open January 31st & February 1st.

Huron Meadows Metropark (Brighton).conditions: Bucks Run WAS groomed - then 2” of the fluffy stuff landed on top. Classic tracks are skied back in. Skaters are getting a workout.

Stoney Creek Metropark (Shelby Township).conditions: Almost all trails have fresh park set tracks, but exposed areas were sometimes drifted over. There are some oak leave patches in the woods where deer have been digging for acorns. Despite these issues skiing was the best I've seen at Stoney in a long time,

nubsNob.liftsOpen: 5 chairlifts, Rope Tow and the Space Worm
nubsNob.xcTrails: Trails will be power-tilled and tracked today. Conditions are very good.
nubsNob.nightSkiing: Tuesday thru Saturday from 5:30 to 9:00 p.m.
nubsNob.comments: Welcome to another beautiful ski day at Nub's Nob. Yesterday there was frequent snow in the air that only accumulated to an inch but it further improved the already great snow conditions. The majority of the snow surface is machine groomed and in awesome shape for carving turns. This winter has been a real gift to skiers and riders in Northern Michigan, we are now 21 straight days without a thaw. Pintail Peak Lodge is open with food service and an espresso bar. The soup of the day is hominy and ham chowder or tomato for the less adventurous. The lifts will spin from 9:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. today with an hour break at 4:30. Make it a great day at Nub's Nob.
